comments.body: We should also verify that the top of the title is > 0. Once the MD team has signed of on a min vertical padding value (or some algorithm) we could refine testVerticalGeometry() further
Done.  Also verified that the top centers the title in the widget.

Does this mean that when a widget is interactive, it's not necessarily focusable? 

I'm thinking about the case where `ListTile.enabled = true` and `onTap`/`onLongPress` is set to null. If I understand this correctly, this might just mean that the ListTile is "active", but not really interactive and is more so an issue with the wording in the API docs.

I think it's an issue with the API docs. If it doesn't have any tap/press handlers, then you can't activate the `ListTile` in any meaningful way, so if it's just got `enabled` set, but null handlers, allowing it to be focused just doesn't make any sense because you can't trigger anything. And allowing focus when `enabled` is false, but there are handlers is probably worse, since you could focus it and trigger the handlers without being able to tap on it to do that.

ListTile is an old widget, and I suspect we weren't as consistent about using null handlers to indicate being disabled, and so it has an `enabled` as well, which is redundant.

I think "active" and "interactive" mean the same thing.
